question: What is the name of the strait that separates the island country of the Dominican Republic in the Hispaniola Islands and Puerto Rico?
explanation: Mona Passage is the name of the strait that separates the island country of the Dominican Republic in the Hispaniola Islands and Puerto Rico. This strait generally separates Hispaniola Islands, which includes both Haiti and Dominican Republic, from Puerto Rico. Mona Passage connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Caribbean Sea. It is an important shipping route between the Atlantic and the Panama Canal.
